Title: Summer vacation 2019 part three
Description: I enjoy photographing dragonflies and damselflies; this year I got some pretty reasonable shots of common blue damselflies, white-faced meadowhawks, a twelve-spotted skimmer, and my favourite, ebon…

Title: Turning the Nintendo Switch into Android’s best gaming hardware
Description: You got your Google OS in my Nintendo hardware!

Title: Chrome, Firefox to expunge Extended Validation cert signals
Description: Google and Mozilla have decided to eliminate Extended Validation signals in their desktop browsers; the certificates were designed  to assure users they landed on a legitimate site, not a malicious copycat.

Title: A bootstrapper script for the Cake .NET Core Global Tool on Alpine using ash
Description: In this post I provide an Almquist shell (ash) bootstrapper script for the Cake.Tool .NET Core global tool on Alpine Linux

Title: How to build with Cake on Linux using Cake.CoreCLR or the Cake global tool
Description: In this post I show how to build .NET Core projects on Linux using the Cake.CoreCLR library or the .NET Core global tool Cake.Tool.

Title: Quick demo of Ghostly - a Windows GitHub Notification client
Description:
Ghostly is now released and in this video I do a really quick demo of some of the applications features.

Read more about it at:
https://spectresystems.se/ghostly/

You can install it directly from the windows store at:
https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/ghostly/9n5mvrb0xc60

Title: Managing SSL certificates may be getting that much more difficult
Description: A blog with tips, tricks and gotchas about Microsoft products - Primarily Exchange, Office 365, identity solutions, and Windows Server.

Title: Overleaf, Online LaTeX Editor
Description: An online LaTeX editor that's easy to use. No installation, real-time collaboration, version control, hundreds of LaTeX templates, and more.

Title: Massive biometric security flaw exposed more than one million fingerprints
Description: Security company Suprema says it will let customers know if there's any risk involved.

Title: Cloud Native Show: What’s Cloud Native, Really?
Description:
Get the definition from the engineers on campus up close and personal on the Cloud Native Show. In our Pilot episode, follow Shayne as he explores the Microsoft campus to have Cloud Native explained to him by Distinguished Engineer, Brendan Burns. For more episodes be sure to subscribe at https://aka.ms/cloudnativeshow

Free Azure Account: https://azure.microsoft.com/free/?WT....
Build cloud-native applications in Azure: https://azure.microsoft.com/overview/...
Free eBook : Designing Distributed Systems by Brendan Burns - https://azure.microsoft.com/resources...
What about cloud-native applications? https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/sta...

01:14 - Two really important aspects of cloud native 
02:42  - Brendan talks about concept of Blue/Green deployments
03:45 - Shayne asks, “Is this just SOA redifined?”
06:43 - Is tooling the hardest part?
10:22 - Do we jump or stay in Virtual Machines because it’s what we know?
11:48 - Is Kubernetes the thing or are we going somewhere next?
14:10 - Containers are everywhere, is the cloud the final deployment?
16:30 - Brendan answers how to get started.
